channel.title: Network adapter always disabled
channel.description:
I installed a Sweex 300N Wireless PCI card in my desktop today and installed the drivers from the CD, I went on to find out that in the adapter settings it says its disabled, so I enable it, however it wont enable it just constantly sits saying "Disabled" I checked device manager and it is enabled.
I tried it in a different PCI slot but no avail, does anyone have any ideas / clues?
Im using Windows 7 64bit.

item.title: Network adapter always disabled
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

“Device is working properly”

also it says its enabled in device manager but not in the adaptor settings.

edit: re-install of windows solved the problem

Read full topic

item.title: Network adapter always disabled
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

in device manager what does “device status” say

Read full topic

item.title: Network adapter always disabled
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

These are the drivers i used: http://www.wireless-driver.com/download/other/sweex-lw312-wireless-drivers-utility.htm

It says its 32/64 compatible.

Edit: I removed the drivers and installed them by manually routing through the install cd to the 7/x64 folder however the problem still persists.

Read full topic

item.title: Network adapter always disabled
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Were they 64-bit (vista or win7) drivers?
